paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR variant p.Ala65Val, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: progressive impairment of gait, neuropathic pain, dizziness, weight loss, cardiac amyloidosis
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 73-year old male with progressive impairment of gait, persisting neuropathic pain in his legs, dizziness due to postural changes, and unexplained weight loss of 20 kg during the last 2–3 years presented to our outpatient clinic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: cardiomyopathy and peripheral neuropathy of unknown etiology
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The only living brother, aged 68, was considerably impaired by a cardiomyopathy and peripheral neuropathy of unknown etiology.

functional_data.summary: The p.Ala65Val mutation is classified as likely pathogenic based on ACMG criteria.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family; both the proband and his brother carry the variant and exhibit symptoms.
variants.population_frequency: Absent from general population in databases gnomAD/ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on ACMG criteria and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is novel and has not been previously reported in literature for TTR-related conditions.
key_quotes: Molecular genetic analysis revealed a heterozygous sequence variant in exon 2 of the TTR gene (NM_000371.3 (TTR): c.194C>T, p.Ala65Val).
The patient’s family history revealed frequent deaths due to cardiac events in his first-degree relatives.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
